channel.title: How to make file execute on Qube StartUp?
channel.description: I use a few p2p networks like I2p, ZeroNet, FreeNet, e.c.t daily. I set up shortcuts to make them easy to start but is it possible to just set them to start automatically when the Qube Starts? They aren't "normal" apps like the apps when you hover over the Qube as they are mainly .sh files so normal methods might not work.

item.title: How to make file execute on Qube StartUp?
item.dc:creator: tatertot
item.description:
You can invoke your commands from /rw/config/rc.local,
To enable, make rc.local executable.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make file execute on Qube StartUp?

item.title: How to make file execute on Qube StartUp?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
As per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Free_Support_Principle ever method that works for Qubes also works for Qubes-Whonix.
